item.description:
volunteersElana, Molly Killy - Window time, then put himself away.Multi column Medical ğŸªŸ WT, then put himself away. Multi column Medical
1.6 mL of 1.5 mg/mL Metacam PO
PT on L foot. Bumble foot on R foot so we did a ball wrap with a pool noodle. We initially did a ball wrap on the L foot as well, but then the bird was unable to stand and appeared to be very stressed by that. We removed the wrap on L foot in hopes that it would encourage use. Multi column Food Medical
0.7 mL of 1.5 mg/mL Metacam PO
No PLR
Did not ğŸ«± HF well. Multi column Food Medical
TAB R eye
1.44 mL of 1.5 mg/mL Metacam PO
62.5 mg Clavamox Removed body wrap and soaked wound on keel, R leg, and L wing with wound wash. Applied wet to dry wrap over the top of wound on keel. Put in cage with rolly bed and warm buddy. Started shaking its head back and forth so we did not attempt to HF more. Very out of it so we did not leave more food in the cage. Multi column Food Medical
30 mL ğŸ’‰Fluids in R ing Did full exam today. No injuries appreciated.

- #ğŸ¦…ğŸ©º-bird-care/short-term tPlease clean using the divider.

Clavamox Washed body and lacerations with diluted chlorhexidine. Picked some of the scaly yellow  substance from the chest, legs & back.  Under anesthesia sutured the small hole in the R patagium, left open.  Applied TAB to chest laceration, then wet to dry with tegaderm and then vet wrap to hold in place.  Applied TAB to other scraps (both knees,L wing) did not cover.  Extensive bruising on chest, legs, wings, back. Set up on a warm buddy and rolly bed.

ğŸ€ JR Medical Flew HP-HP. Multi column Food 4 ğŸ­ğŸ­ğŸ­ Medical Flew around cage and also between cages. Short flights nearly silent. volunteers- 1.  Baby robin in CR. Asked to renest, provided Dr Jana number.  Call from Durant, suspected owl #2596 was mowed over by sickle mower. Caller brought bird to clinic.  Call from Dubuque, hawk (likely redtail) under tree and not moving. Caller doesnâ€™t have time to capture. Provided various possible closer rehab #. Called back to say no one responded. Caller will try to take pic tomorrow AM and call Kathy. Call from Charles City, injured GHOW, provided various possible closer rehab #, called back to say no one responded, Kathy texted Teresa at Blackhawk, she is taking bird, caller is transporting to her.  Call from CR, hawk by dumpster, not moving, asked for picture, caller called back to say bird flew away.  Scott County Humane Society brought in BDOW (#2595). They suspected HBC. Call Davenport, woman said daughter picked up injured heron. Provided possible rehabbers, Iowa Bird Rehab is meeting her half way tomorrow to pick up bird. Call from Dubuque, caller had an injured bat. Provided possible rehabbers. Cautioned about rabies.
item.dc:creator: Jay S

item.description:
volunteersDenise, Jennifer Multi column Notice #ğŸ¦…ğŸ’¥-significant-event ğŸ¥³ Released! Rohret Road in Iowa City Finder notified and paperwork filed. Medical These two males were a lot different than the female we released earlier.The female jumped up to the hole and was gone in 2 minutes.This time, the first male jumped up to the hole after 5 minutes.And spent another 20 minutes sitting there until he took off.I waited until an hour, and the other male did not appear.I had a commitment that I needed to attend, and he had not appeared at the hole yet. After I returned at about 4:30, I checked the nest, and he had left.There was an adult male within 100 yards east of the nest and two younger kestrels within 200 yards east of the nest, so I am sure they will have lots of company.   I just came back from a drive while checking on the kestrels.This afternoon on the power lines on Rohret by the hay field where there was one adult and two young kestrels.Tonight there are now one adult and 4 young kestrels.I think this may be working out. (How awesome is that?!  We so appreciate Donâ€™s dedication to AMKEs and all the nest boxes he monitors, including mine!) Multi column Food 0 Medical

Multi column Notice Will be with Sonja until 7/24 for a program. Food Medical In box. volunteers- The saved voice message from yesterday is for Sonja about raptor education and the Cub Scouts. Quad Cities, barn swallows, referred Dr. Jana. Iowa City, bird nest by house vent and finder claims that there are feather mites coming into his house from the nest (sounds like barn swallows). Explained highly unlikely and illegal to relocate.
